verses.verse: When Rachel<WH7354> saw<WH7200> that she bore<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> no children,<WH7354> Rachel envied<WH7065> her sister.<WH269> She said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "Give<WH3051> me children,<WH1121> or else<WH369> I will die.<WH4191>"
Jacob<WH3290>'s anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against Rachel,<WH7354> and he said,<WH559> "Am I in God<WH430>'s place,<WH4513> who has withheld from you the fruit<WH6529> of the womb?<WH990>"
She said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH519> my maid Bilhah.<WH1090> Go in<WH935> to her,<WH3205> that she may bear on my knees,<WH1290> and I also may obtain children by her.<WH1129>"
She gave<WH5414> him Bilhah<WH1090> her handmaid<WH8198> as wife,<WH802> and Jacob<WH3290> went in to her.<WH935>
Bilhah<WH1090> conceived,<WH2029> and bore<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a son.<WH1121>

Rachel<WH7354> said,<WH559> "God<WH430> has judged<WH1777> me,<WH8085> and has also heard my voice,<WH6963> and has given<WH5414> me a son.<WH1121>" Therefore called<WH7121> she his name<WH8034> Dan.<WH1835>
Bilhah,<WH1090> Rachel<WH7354>'s handmaid,<WH8198> conceived<WH2029> again,<WH3205> and bore Jacob<WH3290> a second<WH8145> son.<WH1121>
Rachel<WH7354> said,<WH559> "With mighty<WH430> wrestlings<WH5319> have I wrestled<WH6617> with my sister,<WH269> and have prevailed.<WH3201>" She named<WH8034> him<WH7121> Naphtali.<WH5321>
When Leah<WH3812> saw<WH7200> that she had finished<WH5975> bearing,<WH3205> she took<WH3947> Zilpah,<WH2153> her handmaid,<WH8198> and gave<WH5414> her to Jacob<WH3290> as a wife.<WH802>
Zilpah,<WH2153> Leah<WH3812>'s handmaid,<WH8198> bore<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a son.<WH1121>
Leah<WH3812> said,<WH559> "How<WH1409> fortunate!<WH935>" She named<WH8034> him<WH7121> Gad.<WH1410>
Zilpah,<WH2153> Leah<WH3812>'s handmaid,<WH8198> bore<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a second<WH8145> son.<WH1121>
Leah<WH3812> said,<WH559> "Happy am I,<WH837> for the daughters<WH1323> will call me happy.<WH833>" She named<WH8034> him<WH7121> Asher.<WH836>

Reuben<WH7205> went in<WH3212> the days<WH3117> of wheat<WH2406> harvest,<WH7105> and found<WH4672> mandrakes<WH1736> in the field,<WH7704> and brought<WH935> them to his mother,<WH517> Leah.<WH3812> Then Rachel<WH7354> said<WH559> to Leah,<WH3812> "Please give me<WH5414> some of your son<WH1121>'s mandrakes.<WH1736>"

She said<WH559> to her,<WH4592> "Is it a small matter that you have taken<WH3947> away my husband?<WH376> Would you take away<WH3947> my son<WH1121>'s mandrakes,<WH1736> also?<WH7354>" Rachel said,<WH559> "Therefore he will lie<WH7901> with you tonight<WH3915> for<WH8478> your son<WH1121>'s mandrakes.<WH1736>"

Jacob<WH3290> came<WH935> from the field<WH7704> in the evening,<WH6153> and Leah<WH3812> went out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> him,<WH559> and said, "You must come in<WH935> to me;<WH7936> for I have surely hired<WH7936> you with my son<WH1121>'s mandrakes.<WH1736>" He lay<WH7901> with her that night.<WH3915>
God<WH430> listened to Leah,<WH3812> and she conceived,<WH2029> and bore<WH3205> Jacob<WH3290> a fifth<WH2549> son.<WH1121>
Leah said, "God has given me my hire, because I gave my handmaid to my husband." She named him Issachar.
Leah<WH3812> conceived<WH2029> again,<WH3205> and bore a sixth<WH8345> son<WH1121> to Jacob.<WH3290>

Leah<WH3812> said,<WH559> "God<WH430> has endowed<WH2064> me with a good<WH2896> dowry.<WH2065> Now<WH6471> my husband<WH376> will live<WH2082> with me,<WH3205> because I have borne him six<WH8337> sons.<WH1121>" She named<WH8034> him<WH7121> Zebulun.<WH2074>
Afterwards,<WH310> she bore<WH3205> a daughter,<WH1323> and named<WH8034> her<WH7121> Dinah.<WH1783>
God<WH430> remembered<WH2142> Rachel,<WH7354> and God<WH430> listened<WH8085> to her,<WH6605> and opened her womb.<WH7358>
She conceived,<WH2029> bore<WH3205> a son,<WH1121> and said,<WH559> "God<WH430> has taken away<WH622> my reproach.<WH2781>"
She named<WH8034> him<WH7121> Joseph,<WH3130> saying,<WH559> "May Yahweh<WH3068> add<WH3254> another<WH312> son to me.<WH1121>"

It happened,<WH7354> when Rachel had borne<WH3205> Joseph,<WH3130> that Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to Laban,<WH3837> "Send me away,<WH7971> that I may go<WH3212> to my own place,<WH4725> and to my country.<WH776>

Give<WH5414> me my wives<WH802> and my children<WH3206> for<WH2004> whom I have served<WH5647> you,<WH3212> and let me go; for you know<WH3045> my service<WH5656> with which I have served you.<WH5647>"

Laban<WH3837> said<WH559> to him,<WH4672> "If now I have found favor<WH2580> in your eyes,<WH5869> stay here,<WH5172> for I have divined that Yahweh<WH3068> has blessed<WH1288> me for your sake.<WH1558>"
He said,<WH559> "Appoint<WH5344> me your wages,<WH7939> and I will give it.<WH5414>"
He said<WH559> to him,<WH3045> "You know how<WH834> I have served<WH5647> you,<WH834> and how your livestock have fared with me.<WH4735>

For it was little<WH4592> which you had before I<WH6440> came,<WH6555> and it has increased to a multitude.<WH7230> Yahweh<WH3068> has blessed<WH1288> you wherever I turned.<WH7272> Now when<WH4970> will I provide<WH6213> for my own house also?<WH1004>"

He said,<WH559> "What shall I give you?<WH5414>" Jacob<WH3290> said,<WH559> "You<WH5414> shall not give<WH5414> me anything.<WH6213> If you will do this thing<WH1697> for me,<WH7725> I will again feed<WH7462> your flock<WH6629> and keep it.<WH8104>

I will pass<WH5674> through all your flock<WH6629> today,<WH3117> removing<WH5493> from there every speckled<WH5348> and spotted<WH2921> one,<WH7716> and every black<WH2345> one<WH7716> among the sheep,<WH3775> and the spotted<WH2921> and speckled<WH5348> among the goats.<WH5795> This will be my hire.<WH7939>

So my righteousness<WH6666> will answer<WH6030> for me hereafter,<WH3117> when<WH4279> you come<WH935> concerning my hire<WH7939> that is before you.<WH6440> Every one<WH3605> that is not speckled<WH5348> and spotted<WH2921> among the goats,<WH5795> and black<WH2345> among the sheep,<WH3775> that might be with me,<WH1589> will be counted stolen."
Laban<WH3837> said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH3863> let it be according to your word.<WH1697>"

That day,<WH3117> he removed<WH5493> the male goats<WH8495> that were streaked<WH6124> and spotted,<WH2921> and all the female goats<WH5795> that were speckled<WH5348> and spotted,<WH2921> every one that had white<WH3836> in it,<WH2345> and all the black ones among the sheep,<WH3775> and gave<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of his sons.<WH1121>
He set<WH7760> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>' journey<WH1870> between himself and Jacob,<WH3290> and Jacob<WH3290> fed<WH7462> the rest<WH3498> of Laban<WH3837>'s flocks.<WH6629>

Jacob<WH3290> took<WH3947> to himself rods<WH4731> of fresh<WH3892> poplar,<WH3839> almond,<WH3869> plane tree,<WH6196> peeled<WH6478> white<WH3836> streaks<WH6479> in them,<WH3836> and made the white appear<WH4286> which was in the rods.<WH4731>

He set<WH3322> the rods<WH4731> which he had peeled<WH6478> opposite<WH6478> the flocks<WH6629> in the gutters<WH7298> in the<WH4325> watering-troughs<WH8268> where the flocks<WH6629> came<WH935> to drink.<WH8354> They conceived<WH3179> when they came<WH935> to drink.<WH8354>
The flocks<WH6629> conceived<WH3179> before the rods,<WH4731> and the flocks<WH6629> produced<WH3205> streaked,<WH6124> speckled,<WH5348> and spotted.<WH2921>

Jacob<WH3290> separated<WH6504> the lambs,<WH3775> and set<WH5414> the faces<WH6440> of the flocks<WH6629> toward<WH413> the streaked<WH6124> and all the black<WH2345> in the flock<WH6629> of Laban:<WH3837> and he put<WH7896> his own droves<WH5739> apart,<WH7896> and didn't put them into Laban<WH3837>'s flock.<WH6629>

It happened,<WH7194> whenever the stronger of the flock<WH6629> conceived,<WH3179> that Jacob<WH3290> laid<WH7760> the rods<WH4731> before the eyes<WH5869> of the flock<WH6629> in the gutters,<WH7298> that they might conceive<WH3179> among the rods;<WH4731>
but when the flock<WH6629> were feeble,<WH5848> he didn't<WH7760> put them in. So the feebler<WH5848> were Laban<WH3837>'s, and the stronger<WH7194> Jacob<WH3290>'s.
The man<WH376> increased<WH6555> exceedingly,<WH3966> and had large<WH7227> flocks,<WH6629> female servants<WH8198> and male servants,<WH5650> and camels<WH1581> and donkeys.<WH2543>
